intro: Mystacidium gerrardii, commonly known as the golden mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on various host trees, primarily in the southeastern United States. Mystacidium gerrardii is often found in humid, shaded environments, thriving in the canopy of hardwood forests.
